suzeandthestruggle: I have a paralysis anniversary ‘celebration’ every year; I do something celebratory on the anniversary of the day I woke up unable to walk. I mostly do it to mark how far I’ve come from that day; to remain thankful that - even with reduced mobility, chronic fatigue, and significant pain - I am still here and living a wonderful life. I find it grounding and humbling; a significant part in the acceptance of my illness and finding joy in the ordinary. So, all that is to say, I’d highly recommend marking the occasion. Xxx Ps. This photo is EVERYTHING. Pps. Thank you so much for raising awareness for those of us living with a variety of disabilities. Xx
